ARABIC: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'My Lord, grant me a reprieve until the Day they are raised again.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O my Lord," said he, "give me respite till the day the dead are raised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Iblis said: "My Lord! Grant me respite till the Day when they will be resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Iblis prayed, "Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Judgment".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “My Lord! Grant me respite till the day when they will all be raised.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: [Iblis] said: "O my Lord! Then give me respite until the Day they (the dead) will be resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: My Lord! then respite me till the time when they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said he, 'My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Satan said, "O my Lord! Grant me respite till the Day of Resurrection."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: my Lord! respite me then till the Day whereon they will be raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day they (the dead) will be resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He said: 'My Lord, reprieve me till the Day they are raised'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “My Lord, reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:36] Said he, ‘My Lord! Reprieve me until the day when they, mankind, shall be resurrected’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Iblis said: (My Lord!) O my Lord! (Reprieve me till the day when they are raised) from the grave; the accursed did not wish to taste death.
